comment: Most predictions are correct, but some stroke cases are missed and some non-stroke are falsely flagged.
Age, glucose level, and BMI have the strongest influence on stroke prediction.
High AUC indicates good ability to distinguish between stroke and non-stroke patients.
Using a threshold of 0.3 increases stroke detection but also raises false positives.
SVM predicts well overall, but still confuses some stroke and non-stroke cases.
Key contributing features are similar to Logistic Regression, though weight magnitudes differ.
High AUC shows strong class separation performance.
At threshold 0.3, recall improves but false alarms also increase.
XGBoost achieves the fewest misclassifications among all models.
Age and glucose are the most impactful factors for predicting stroke.
Highest AUC, meaning XGBoost has the best discrimination ability.
Lowering the threshold improves sensitivity but increases false positives.
